Bagrati6n cast his large, expressionless, sleepy eyes round his suite, and the boyish face of Ros- tov, breathless with excitement and hope, was the first to catch his eye. He sent him. 
"And if I should meet His Majesty before I meet the commander in chief, your excellency?" said Rost6v, with his hand to his cap. 
"You can give the message to His Majesty," said Dolgorukov, hurriedly interrupting Ba- grati6n.
